item.title: Coding a neural network with only numpy?
A mathematical introduction to feedforward neural networks
item.description: The introduction of feedforward neural networks and their application to early problems such as recognising handwritten digits from the MNIST dataset was a landmark achievement. Despite their limited standalone use today, they still remain the backbone of various models of wide range of modern architectures Incredibly, the backpropagation algorithm, which only started gaining traction in the 1980’s, is still used when updating the billions of trainable parameters in the massive LLMs we see today.

item.title: About
item.description:
Hi there! I’m Ben, and welcome to my personal website!

I’m currently a 1st year student studying mathematics at the University of Cambridge. This is a place where I’ll be documenting a lot of the academic stuff I’m working on.
